connector.description: Forward data to a Fhir endpoint.

camel.kamelet.fhir-sink.apiName.name: camel.kamelet.fhir-sink.apiName
camel.kamelet.fhir-sink.apiName.description: What kind of operation to perform

camel.kamelet.fhir-sink.methodName.name: camel.kamelet.fhir-sink.methodName
camel.kamelet.fhir-sink.methodName.description: What sub operation to use for the selected operation.

camel.kamelet.fhir-sink.encoding.name: camel.kamelet.fhir-sink.encoding
camel.kamelet.fhir-sink.encoding.description: Encoding to use for all request. One of: [JSON] [XML].

camel.kamelet.fhir-sink.log.name: camel.kamelet.fhir-sink.log
camel.kamelet.fhir-sink.log.description: Will log every requests and responses.

camel.kamelet.fhir-sink.lazyStartProduce.name: camel.kamelet.fhir-sink.lazyStartProducer
camel.kamelet.fhir-sink.lazyStartProduce.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel’s routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.kamelet.fhir-sink.username.name: camel.kamelet.fhir-sink.username
camel.kamelet.fhir-sink.username.description: Username to use for basic authentication.

camel.kamelet.fhir-sink.password.name: camel.kamelet.fhir-sink.password
camel.kamelet.fhir-sink.password.description: Password to use for basic authentication.
